description: EXTENSIONS AND ALTERATIONS TO EXISITING BUILDINGS AND DEMOLITION OF EXISTING KINDERGARTEN BUILDING.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 2934,19P001 A (Main Building Existing Floor Plans); 2934,19P002 A (The Sparrows & Kindergarten Existing Floor Plan); 2934,19P003 A (Existing Site Plan); 2934,19P004 A (The Sparrows & Kindergarten Existing Elevations); 2934,19P005 A (Main Building Existing Elevations); 2934,19P006 D (Main Building Proposed Floor Plans); 2934,19P007 C (The Sparrows & Kindergarten Proposed Floor Plans); 2934,19P008 B (Proposed Site Plan); 2934,19P009 E (The Sparrows & Kindergarten Proposed Elevations); 2934,19P010 F (Main Building Proposed Elevations); 2934,19P011 C (Site Location Plan); 2934,19P012 C (Existing & Proposed Site Plan); 2934,19P013 B (The Sparrows & Kindergarten Existing & Proposed Elevations); 2934,19P014 B (Proposed Street Scene); 2934,19P015 A (Block Plan);  Archaeological Desk-Based Assessment (Heritage Statement), by Archeology South-East, January 2020; The Rowans School, Transport Statement, date 17 February 2020 and Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement, dated 11 February.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Demolition and Construction Method Statement:

No development shall take place until a Demolition and Construction Method Statement has been submitted to, and approved in wiriting by, the local planning authority. The approved Statement shall be adhered to throughout the demolition and construction period.

The Statement shall provide for:
- hours of opertation
- the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors
- loading and unloading of plants and materials
- storage of plant materials used constructing the development
- the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate 
- wheel washing facilities
- measures to control the emission of noise and vibration during construction
- measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during contruction/demolition
- a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and contruction works

Reason: To protect the amenities of future occupiers and those in the local vicinity.

Condition : 5 - Trees:

1) Tree Protection

The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'Arboricultural and Method Statement' reference '268133410/3/2019 2.0' and dated '11 February 2020' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works.

Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plans 2014.

Condition : 6 - 2) Trees:

Site Supervision

The details of the approved 'Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statement' shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to monitor and report to the Local Planning Authority not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the demolition and site works.The works shall be carried out in accordance with the Approved Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan.

Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 8 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the western elevation of the main building and eastern side of the proposed Kindergarten building shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 9 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the new development hereby permitted full details of a landscaping and planting scheme (including new tree planting) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved before the commencement of the use or the occupation of any building hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include on a plan, full details of the size, species, spacing, quantities and location of proposed plants, together with any hard surfacing, means of enclosure, and indications of all existing trees, hedges and any other features to be retained, and measures for their protection during the course of development.
